author: freehouse_throwaway
body:
Theta play on semi next week (AMD/NVDA) is prob best bet.. just make sure you sell OTM enough...

Granted this is based on LRCX/INTC/XLNX but things sure look priced in as fuck.

author: HomieNR
body:
I'm not familiar with dividend drips. (Disclaimer: I am by no means professional)  in this period I focus on buying strong companies who also pay a decent dividend. For example i have been buying BMY and ABBV on a 30% discount (3.5% and 5.5% dividend respectively). But also stocks with a lot of growth potential like ENPH and LRCX. I am not done buying so whenever they get cheaper I spill in some more. These are not recommendations but stocks I have found potential in. 

Good thing about dividend stocks is that they tend to have a more stable price and not swing down that much.

author: HazardousMako
body:
Shit needs to get throttled to the downside...

I'm sitting here looking at tech, particularly LRCX with their earnings after hours.

Looking from 2018 on by a quarterly basis, their revenue has been nothing but down quarter over quarter. The only reason their EPS continues to tick higher is because they buy back their stock and decrease share / float amount.

Their Free Cash Flow continues to deteriorate and go down...

They say demand is still strong in Asia, with nearly 1/3 of their revenues from China. You telling me they still working over there with their fake numbers?

Shit stinks but these analysts eat it up.

author: whatyoulookinatbud
body: I agree with you that trading US stocks on WS is a bad idea. If it’s just a one time thing though and you’re planning to hold, it’s okay to eat the extra 1.5% fee one time. The semis sector ran hard after TSM earnings this past week. More earnings coming up this week with TXN, LRCX and XLNX. The Tec etf discussed above is barely affected by the semis sector.

author: your_mom_loves_me69
body: Its LRCX, he mixed up the ticker

author: freehouse_throwaway
body: need XLNX and LRCX to both take a dump por favor

author: HoosierPride
body: Word on the street is LRCX should have good earnings based on MU PC commentary. Will see if that materializes a bit of a gamble playing earnings in this market

author: CapitalC5
body:
Don't know what part of the financials you mean when talking about impressive growth, but a company like AMAT "only" grew 38% in the last 5 years in terms of revenue. Also, the assets of LRCX stood still for the last 4 years, not really what you'd be looking for in a semiconductor company. They both also lost revenue in 2019.

They are definitely not bad companies, but I wouldn't say top 5. They have however an attractive rate, but when everything's on sale, I would first look at best financials and then look at good rates. 

My top 5 buy at this moment would be GOOGL, BRK.B, FB, GILD and SEDG

author: YesThisIsBare
body:
Roth IRA: ~15% VBTLX (bonds), ~60% VTWAX (total world stock), ~25% VSIAX (small cap value). Once I finish maxing it for this year, I'll rebalance to 10% bonds, 67.5% world stock, 22.5% SCV.

457(b): 75% in a target date fund, the rest in cash to eventually move to the plan's brokerage option. If I can snag any of V, MA, BAM, AMT, CCI, AOS, COST, or CTAS on the cheap, I'd be thrilled.

Taxable account: 100 shares RCEL, 18 shares NVEE, ~6.3 shares LRCX (which I've been dripping for about two years now), 1 DIS 90p 5/15/20, -1 DIS 85p 5/15/20. I eventually want to open positions in TTD and GH.

author: DTLACoder
body: Made a 75% profit on some LRCX calls i picked up this morning, good day

author: BF5lagsssss
body: But semiconductor got the Huawei incident. I really not sure what will happen to the semiconductor supply chain if the new proposals are effective for high end chips. I mean the key semiconductor equipment makers are Lam Research, KLA Tencor, Applied Materials and Teradyne are going to take a hit no matter what. Out of those 4 above Teradyne would be hit hardest as it will be replaced by Advantest.

author: Glockachuuuu
body: I mean the market is all about speculation because of the times like this. What if in 2023 Tesla at 750 was super cheap. What if after Coronavirus all these automobile industries are forced to make electric vehicles because of all the smog less photos of LA and NY during the virus. You just never know but never say a stock is not at a bargain price. I’ve heard it too many times with Amazon, Google, Apple, Lam Research
